column4: I haven't looked but I bet the link to the webpage explains it. :)
probably easier to sudo apt-get install pastebinit;  cat /etc/default/grub | pastebinit .... just sayin
do you remember my flash delay problem?
I read some about it yes.

i found the solution, but it is only for firefox, maybe you could help me applying it to chrome. I'll show you: I did exactly this and the delay competely dissapeared: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1760248&page=3
meaning you followed that in Firefox?
what? sorry. I followed these steps and solved it in forefox. -> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pulseaudio/+bug/294666/comments/34     but I want to make it work properly in chromium
I'm not sure I'm the one to ask about using this fix for chromium..
lol ok I see what they're doing.
make a copy of the file thay had you make for firefox, rename it chromium or somesuch
on the last line change it to exec /usr/bin/chromium-browser "$@"
not working as in? still have sound issues? browser won't start? details please

I tried  to create another file named chromium-browser with the same contain that the firefox one. Of course i changed the firefox line to chromium-browser but when i try to execute it it says: "bash: /user/local/bin/chromium-browser: No existe el archivo o el directorio
nvm , typping error. I could execute it but the delay isnt fixed
yea just noted that, but look up :p
hmmm, sorry beyond that I don't know what to tell you. Thought modifying the script might have worked.
